messages.subject: Re: attachment question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Tanya! Yes, it s gone now -- and hey, not a problem! I was just wondering what it was -- I had clicked on it, and was asked if I wanted to open it or save
messages.messageBody:
Hi Tanya!
Yes, it's gone now -- and hey, not a problem!
I was just wondering what it was -- I had clicked on it, and was asked
if I wanted to open it or save it do disk, and so I cancelled.
I assumed I shouldn't run it... I think I got one with the same
extension a year or so ago -- but it didn't look like a rollodex card -- I
didn't know better at the time, and so I ran it, but if I remember
correctly, my computer didn't know what to do with it anyway.
Just wondered:)
THanks!
Tamara in Indy

Date: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 12:39 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] attachment question


>From: "Don and Tamara Kelley" <kelley@...>
>
>Hi everyone!
> I've received an attachment with a .vcf extension on a couple of my
>lists now -- it shows up as a little rolodex card in the cornere of the
>mail.
> Does anyone have any idea what this is?? I've seen it as an attachment
>to an e-mail in the past, but just once or twice, and now I'm getting it a
>lot!!
> I'm a little concerned about this, and *have not* tried to run it, but
>have *no idea* what it might be!!
> I'm using Outlook Express 4.72*...* and Internet Explorer, btw.
>TIA!
>Tamara kelley@...

messages.msgSnippet: I think that little rolodex thing is comming from me, when I set up my new signature at the bottom of my email, but how do I make that thing go away? I will
messages.messageBody:
I think that little rolodex thing is comming from me, when I set up my new
signature at the bottom of my email, but how do I make that thing go away? I
will work on it, but it is harmless, it just has me in it its kind of
strange sorry for the inconvenience and pardon me while I try to get rid of
it!
thanks Tanya Ohio
Tanya M Simpson

messages.subject: attachment question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone! I ve received an attachment with a .vcf extension on a couple of my lists now -- it shows up as a little rolodex card in the cornere of the mail.
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone!
I've received an attachment with a .vcf extension on a couple of my
lists now -- it shows up as a little rolodex card in the cornere of the
mail.
Does anyone have any idea what this is?? I've seen it as an attachment
to an e-mail in the past, but just once or twice, and now I'm getting it a
lot!!
I'm a little concerned about this, and *have not* tried to run it, but
have *no idea* what it might be!!
I'm using Outlook Express 4.72*...* and Internet Explorer, btw.
TIA!
Tamara kelley@...

"I would be most happy if my children grew up to be the
kind of people who think decorating consists of building
enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen
